chinese: fall in drops （液体）滴下，沥下
examples: e.g. She was hot and sweat [[dripped]] into her eyes.；e.g. Her boots were muddy and her hair was [[dripping]].

chinese: let liquid fall in drops 滴（水）；滴下（液体）
examples: e.g. She was hot and sweat [[dripped]] into her eyes.；e.g. Her boots were muddy and her hair was [[dripping]].

chinese: 1) breathless 使人喘不过气来的
examples: e.g. She had a car accident and suffered a [[breathtaking]] pain.；e.g. The view from my bedroom window was absolutely [[breathtaking]].

chinese: 2) very impressive, exciting, or surprising 激动人心的；惊人的；令人惊叹的
examples: e.g. She had a car accident and suffered a [[breathtaking]] pain.；e.g. The view from my bedroom window was absolutely [[breathtaking]].

chinese: [U] (BrE fulfilment) the feeling of being happy and satisfied with your life because you are doing interesting, useful, or important things 成就感；充实感
examples: e.g. Are you looking for greater [[fulfillment]] and satisfaction in your work?

chinese: very happy, or likely to make people very happy 欢乐的；令人高兴的
examples: e.g. It was a [[joyful]] reunion of all the family.

chinese: 1) (fml.) similar and happening at the same time 相似的；同时发生的
examples: e.g. Social changes in Britain are matched by [[parallel]] trends in some other countries.；e.g. The railway is [[parallel]] with the canal.

chinese: 2) two lines, paths, etc. that are parallel to each other are the same distance apart along their whole length 平行的
examples: e.g. Social changes in Britain are matched by [[parallel]] trends in some other countries.；e.g. The railway is [[parallel]] with the canal.

chinese: (fml.) bigger, better, or worse than anything else 无比的；无双的；空前的
examples: e.g. They enjoyed success on a scale [[unparalleled]] by any previous pop group.

chinese: 1) not pleasant and not sensitive to people's feelings 伤人的；不顾他人感受的
examples: e.g. She spoke with [[brutal]] honesty — I was too old for the job.；e.g. Jensen is a dangerous man, and can be very [[brutal]] and reckless (不顾后果的).

chinese: 2) very cruel and violent 野蛮的；凶残的
examples: e.g. She spoke with [[brutal]] honesty — I was too old for the job.；e.g. Jensen is a dangerous man, and can be very [[brutal]] and reckless (不顾后果的).

chinese: [U] the quality of being honest 诚实；正直；坦诚
examples: e.g. She answered all my questions with her usual [[honesty]].

chinese: too unpleasant, painful, or annoying to deal with 难以忍受的；承受不住的；无法容忍的
examples: e.g. The atmosphere at work at the moment is quite [[unbearable]].

chinese: laugh at sb. and make jokes in order to have fun by embarrassing them, either in a friendly way or in an unkind way 戏弄；逗弄；拿···取笑（开玩笑）
examples: e.g. I used to hate being [[teased]] about my red hair when I was at school.

chinese: try to make sb. angry or upset by saying unkind things to them （用语言）挑衅，侮辱，嘲弄，奚落
examples: e.g. It's wrong for you to [[taunt]] him because of his size.

chinese: 1) make sb. want to have or do sth., even though they know they really should not 诱惑；引诱；诱使
examples: e.g. Don't [[tempt]] thieves by leaving valuables clearly visible.；e.g. They [[tempted]] him to join the company by offering him a large salary and a company car.

chinese: 2) try to persuade sb. to do sth. by making it seem attractive 劝说；鼓励
examples: e.g. Don't [[tempt]] thieves by leaving valuables clearly visible.；e.g. They [[tempted]] him to join the company by offering him a large salary and a company car.

chinese: always supporting your friends, principles, country, etc. 忠贞的；忠实的；忠诚的
examples: e.g. Jack has been a [[loyal]] worker in this company for almost 50 years.

chinese: (usu. in negatives) stop yourself from having sth. that you like very much or doing sth. that you want to do 忍住；按捺
examples: e.g. He was unable to [[resist]] the temptation to buy the wallet.

chinese: 1) [C, U] the act of celebrating 庆祝；祝贺；颂扬
examples: e.g. This was not a memorial service but a [[celebration]] of his life.；e.g. There were wild street [[celebrations]] when England won the Cup.

chinese: 2) [C] an occasion or party when you celebrate sth. 庆祝会；庆祝活动
examples: e.g. This was not a memorial service but a [[celebration]] of his life.；e.g. There were wild street [[celebrations]] when England won the Cup.

chinese: used to say that people or things do sth. or exist together at the same time 与···一起；与···同时
examples: e.g. Most of the staff refused to work [[alongside]] the new team.；e.g. He crossed the street and walked [[alongside]] the park.

chinese: next to the side of sth. 在（···）旁边
examples: e.g. Most of the staff refused to work [[alongside]] the new team.；e.g. He crossed the street and walked [[alongside]] the park.

chinese: [C, U] an inability to stop doing or using sth., esp. sth. harmful 上瘾
examples: e.g. He is now fighting his [[addiction]] to alcohol.

chinese: 1) [C] a pleasant activity 娱乐；消遣
examples: e.g. After a long day of work, I found boating a [[distraction]].；e.g. I study in the library as there are too many [[distractions]] at home.

chinese: 2) [C, U] sth. that stops you paying attention to what you are doing 使人分心的事物
examples: e.g. After a long day of work, I found boating a [[distraction]].；e.g. I study in the library as there are too many [[distractions]] at home.

chinese: 1) [C, U] the colored part of the sky where the sun is appearing in the morning 日出；晨曦；朝霞
examples: e.g. There was a glorious [[sunrise]] over the mountains.；e.g. They went out at [[sunrise]] to go bird-watching.

chinese: 2) [U] the time when the sun first appears in the morning 日出（时分）；黎明；拂晓
examples: e.g. There was a glorious [[sunrise]] over the mountains.；e.g. They went out at [[sunrise]] to go bird-watching.

chinese: in a polite, kind, and generous way, esp. to people of a lower rank 有礼貌地，仁慈地，和蔼地，亲切地（尤指对较低阶层的人们）
examples: e.g. Mr. Martel [[graciously]] agreed to take time out of his busy schedule to answer some questions.

chinese: 1) make sb. lose their physical strength, or become physically weak （使）（某人）虚弱（衰弱）
examples: e.g. Elsa was [[weakened]] by her long illness.；e.g. The new evidence [[weakens]] the case against her.

chinese: 2) make sb. / sth. less powerful or less important, or become less powerful （使）变弱，削弱，减弱
examples: e.g. Elsa was [[weakened]] by her long illness.；e.g. The new evidence [[weakens]] the case against her.

chinese: [C] a small raised area on a surface 凸起；隆起； 鼓包
examples: e.g. Her bicycle hit a [[bump]] in the road and threw her off.；e.g. Tim was a clumsy boy, always [[bumping]] into the furniture.

chinese: hit or knock against sth. 碰；撞
examples: e.g. Her bicycle hit a [[bump]] in the road and threw her off.；e.g. Tim was a clumsy boy, always [[bumping]] into the furniture.

chinese: show or say that sth. will happen in the future 预示；是···的预兆
examples: e.g. The storms of that year [[foreshadowed]] a long period of unstable weather conditions.

chinese: 1) (~s) [pl.] the area just outside the lines that form the edge of a sports field （运动场的）场，边
examples: e.g. Wenger stood on the [[sidelines]] shouting instructions to his team.；e.g. Jim works in a bank, but teaches French in the evenings as a [[sideline]].

chinese: 2) [C] an activity that you do as well as your main job or business, in order to earn more money 副业；兼职
examples: e.g. Wenger stood on the [[sidelines]] shouting instructions to his team.；e.g. Jim works in a bank, but teaches French in the evenings as a [[sideline]].

chinese: always, or for a very long time 永久地；长久地
examples: e.g. Michael and his family have settled [[permanently]] in the States.

chinese: (always + ad. / prep.) move back and away from sth., esp. because you are frightened （尤因恐惧而）退缩，畏缩
examples: e.g. His anger was enough to make the others [[shrink away]] from him.；e.g. Your sweater will [[shrink]] if you wash it at too high a temperature.

chinese: become smaller, or make sth. smaller, through the effects of heat or water （使）缩小；（使）收缩
examples: e.g. His anger was enough to make the others [[shrink away]] from him.；e.g. Your sweater will [[shrink]] if you wash it at too high a temperature.

chinese: try to deal with a difficult problem 处理，对付（难题）
examples: e.g. There is more than one way to [[tackle]] the problem.

chinese: [C, U] the possibility that sth. will happen 可能性；希望
examples: e.g. There is every [[prospect]] of the weather remaining dry this week.

chinese: 1) a bend in a road, river, etc. （道路、河流等的）弯曲处
examples: e.g. As he rounded the [[curve]] he saw her standing by the gate.；e.g. The seats were arranged to form a [[curve]].

chinese: 2) a line that gradually bends like part of a circle 曲线；弧线
examples: e.g. As he rounded the [[curve]] he saw her standing by the gate.；e.g. The seats were arranged to form a [[curve]].

chinese: 1) one of a series of small fences that a person or horse has to jump over during a race （跨栏赛跑或马术比赛中用的）栏架
examples: e.g. She cleared all the [[hurdles]] easily and raced to the finishing line.；e.g. Finding enough money for the project was the first [[hurdle]].

chinese: 2) a problem or difficulty that you must deal with before you can achieve sth. 障碍；困难
examples: e.g. She cleared all the [[hurdles]] easily and raced to the finishing line.；e.g. Finding enough money for the project was the first [[hurdle]].

chinese: [C] (infml.) the end of a marriage or relationship — used esp. in newspapers and magazines 离婚，分手（尤作报刊用语）
examples: e.g. She seems to be getting over her recent [[split]] with her fiancé.；e.g. The party is [[split]] over the issue of immigration.

chinese: (split, split) divide, or make a group of people divide, into smaller groups that have very different opinions （组织内部）产生分歧，分裂
examples: e.g. She seems to be getting over her recent [[split]] with her fiancé.；e.g. The party is [[split]] over the issue of immigration.

chinese: break or make sth. break, either so that it gets lines on its surface, or so that it breaks into pieces （使）破裂；（使）裂开
examples: e.g. Due to her carelessness, she fell and [[cracked]] a bone in her leg.

chinese: having one or more lines on the surface because it is damaged but not completely broken 有裂缝的；有裂痕的
examples: e.g. She passed her tongue over her [[cracked]] lips and tried to speak.

chinese: if you do sth. by choice, you do it because you want to do it and not because you are forced to do it 自己选择的；自愿的
examples: e.g. She repeated that she was very comfortable and lived here [[by choice]].

chinese: for only sb. to have or use; not shared 独有；专用
examples: e.g. I'm going out, so you'll have the place [[to yourself]].

chinese: 1) use all of sth. and not have any more left 用完，耗尽（某物）
examples: e.g. Few of us would know what to do if the supermarkets [[ran out of]] food.；e.g. We must act now because time is [[running out]].

chinese: 2) (of a supply of sth.) be used up （供应品）被用完，被耗尽
examples: e.g. Few of us would know what to do if the supermarkets [[ran out of]] food.；e.g. We must act now because time is [[running out]].

chinese: (also be sick to death of) (spoken) be angry or bored with sth. that has been happening for a long time 对某事感到气愤（厌倦）
examples: e.g. I'm [[sick of]] your rudeness — I won't have it any longer!

chinese: treat sb. badly when you are angry or upset, even though it is not their fault 向（某人）发泄（不满等）；拿（某人）出气
examples: e.g. When he's under pressure at work, he [[takes it out on]] me.

chinese: (infml.) a problem that arises and interferes with forward progress (usu. only temporarily) 前进中的问题（通常是暂时的）
examples: e.g. The project hit [[a bump in the road]] when Tom suddenly resigned.

chinese: start doing or discussing sth. new 开始做（别的事）；换话题
examples: e.g. When you finish, [[move on]] to the next exercise.

chinese: be able to do what you need to do, earn your own money, etc. without help from others 自立；独立自主
examples: e.g. Jack's never learned to [[stand on his own two feet]].
